title: Online Learning Design Workshop for Digital Well-Being

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital tool utilization experience and online learning experience
context.additional_context: A program for vocational training institutions to strengthen social sector job competencies, applying the Digital Wellbeing Framework (DW-FOLD) in offline workshops within a BYOD environment.

learning_goals: Learners can explain the five core principles of the Digital Well-being Framework (DW-FOLD): intentional technology use, cognitive load management, physical-mental balance, social connectivity, and self-reflection.
Learners can identify three or more stress factors occurring during online learning and design practical strategies to mitigate them.
Learners can assess their learning habits and develop improvement plans using a digital well-being checklist.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
